industryZone.title: Industry Zone
industryZone.intro_paragraph1: The APOZ industrial zone is designed as a smart logistics and manufacturing hub, integrating Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ) operations with Qualified Opportunity Zone (QOZ) investor advantages.
industryZone.intro_paragraph2: Industrial zone management ensures smooth operations for tenants while maximizing the site's competitive benefits.
industryZone.core_features_description: Manage facilities, infrastructure, and bonded warehouses. Coordinate with U.S. Customs & Border Protection (CBP) for FTZ compliance. Provide integrated logistics, supply chain, and tenant services. Support cross-border manufacturers relocating to the U.S.
industryZone.teal_description: Strategic master planning integrates FTZ-171 advantages with QOZ tax incentives, creating a world-class industrial ecosystem positioned along the Houston Gulf Coast Corridor for advanced manufacturing and global trade infrastructure.
industryZone.table_tenant_operations_scope: Leasing, onboarding, site orientation, and ongoing tenant relations.
industryZone.table_ftz_administration_scope: Duty-free operations, customs reporting, bonded storage, and compliance audits.
industryZone.table_ftz_administration_impact: Maximizes cost savings for tenants and investors.
industryZone.table_infrastructure_management_scope: Roads, drainage, power, telecom, EV-ready facilities.
industryZone.table_logistics_coordination_scope: Trucking, rail, and last-mile distribution optimization.
industryZone.table_logistics_coordination_impact: Reduces supply chain costs & increases APOZ competitiveness.
industryZone.table_safety_security_scope: 24/7 monitoring, customs-controlled entry, and ESG compliance.

affordableLiving.title: Affordable Living Zone
affordableLiving.intro_paragraph: The residential component of APOZ supports the Phase 1 industrial tenants by providing affordable, high-quality workforce housing within walking or short commuting distance to the industrial park.
affordableLiving.objectives_description: Manage 2,000 affordable homes under Phase 2 development. Provide property services and community amenities to residents. Ensure sustainable, livable, and attractive environments for families. Support APOZ's vision as an integrated 'live-work-play' ecosystem.
affordableLiving.teal_description: Affordable housing development integrated with QOF/LIHTC financing creates a sustainable residential ecosystem supporting industrial workforce needs while delivering long-term value through high occupancy stability and tax-advantaged returns.
affordableLiving.benefit1: Attracts skilled labor for Phase 1 industrial tenants.
affordableLiving.benefit2: Improves employee retention through housing stability.
affordableLiving.benefit3: Enhances the long-term appeal of APOZ for manufacturers and logistics operators.
affordableLiving.benefit4: High Occupancy Stability: Workforce-driven demand ensures consistent rental yields.
affordableLiving.benefit5: QOZ Tax Advantages: Residential investments benefit from capital gains deferral and tax-free growth.
affordableLiving.benefit6: REIT Readiness: Stabilized residential assets can be securitized for exit strategies.
affordableLiving.table_leasing_tenant_scope: Manage rental agreements, onboarding, and renewals.
affordableLiving.table_leasing_tenant_impact: Maintains high occupancy rates and predictable income.
affordableLiving.table_property_maintenance_scope: Ongoing repairs, landscaping, and facility upkeep.
affordableLiving.table_property_maintenance_impact: Enhances asset value and resident satisfaction.
affordableLiving.table_community_services_scope: Operate parks, schools, clinics, recreation areas, and local retail.
affordableLiving.table_security_safety_scope: On-site 24/7 security and compliance with housing regulations.
affordableLiving.table_security_safety_impact: Ensures a safe and comfortable living environment.
affordableLiving.table_sustainability_programs_scope: Implement energy efficiency, waste management, and green spaces.

ftz.title: Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ-171)
ftz.intro_paragraph: Foreign Trade Zone 171 (FTZ-171) is a designated U.S. Customs and Border Protection territory that allows businesses to defer, reduce, or eliminate customs duties on foreign goods. The APOZ property operates under FTZ-171 activation, enabling international trade advantages for industrial tenants.
ftz.activation_step1_process: Submit FTZ site activation application to grantee (Guam Economic Development Authority)
ftz.activation_step2_process: U.S. Customs and Border Protection reviews application and conducts site inspection
ftz.activation_step3_process: CBP approves activation; operator obtains FTZ activity bond
ftz.activation_step5_process: Begin FTZ operations under CBP supervision with admitted foreign merchandise
ftz.activation_step6_process: Submit annual reports to CBP and grantee on FTZ activities
ftz.compliance_security_text: Secure perimeter with controlled access points monitored by CBP
ftz.compliance_inventory_text: Real-time digital system tracking all admitted, manipulated, and removed merchandise
ftz.compliance_record_text: Maintain detailed records of all FTZ transactions for CBP audit (5 years minimum)
ftz.compliance_cbp_access_text: Provide 24/7 CBP access to FTZ facilities for inspection and supervision
ftz.compliance_prohibited_text: No retail trade, domestic merchandise storage (except for export), or activities violating CBP regulations
ftz.compliance_annual_cert_text: Submit annual FTZ activity reports and pay grantee fees
ftz.activities_storage_description: Indefinite storage of foreign merchandise without duty payment
ftz.activities_manufacturing_description: Processing, assembly, manufacturing using foreign and domestic components
ftz.activities_exhibition_description: Display of foreign merchandise for trade shows or demonstrations
ftz.activities_sampling_description: Product testing, quality control, and sample distribution
ftz.activities_destruction_description: Destruction of defective or obsolete merchandise without duty
ftz.activities_reexport_description: Export of foreign merchandise to third countries duty-free

qoz.title: Qualified Opportunity Zone (QOZ)
qoz.intro_paragraph: Qualified Opportunity Zones (QOZs) are economically distressed census tracts designated by the U.S. Treasury to incentivize long-term investment through tax benefits. The APOZ property is located within a federally certified QOZ, making it eligible for significant tax advantages when invested through a Qualified Opportunity Fund.
qoz.criteria_poverty_rate_description: Poverty rate ≥20% or median family income ≤80% of area median
qoz.criteria_adjacent_tracts_description: Low-income tracts adjacent to qualified tracts may be designated
qoz.criteria_federal_cert_description: Nominated by states/territories, certified by U.S. Treasury
qoz.criteria_designation_period_description: Remains QOZ designation through December 31, 2028 (or later)
qoz.compliance_property_location_text: All development must occur within the designated QOZ census tract boundaries
qoz.compliance_substantial_improvement_text: Acquired property must be substantially improved (investment ≥ purchase price) within 30 months
qoz.compliance_original_use_text: Property must be new construction or substantially rehabilitated existing property
qoz.compliance_trade_business_text: Property must be used in active trade or business (not investment holding)
qoz.compliance_documentation_text: Maintain records demonstrating QOZ property qualification and ongoing use

qof.title: Qualified Opportunity Fund (QOF)
qof.intro_paragraph: A Qualified Opportunity Fund (QOF) is an investment vehicle organized as a corporation or partnership for the purpose of investing in Qualified Opportunity Zone property. QOFs must hold at least 90% of their assets in QOZ property to maintain qualified status.
qof.qualification_90_percent_test_descriptio: At least 90% of fund assets must be invested in QOZ property
qof.qualification_self_cert_description: Fund must self-certify to the IRS using Form 8996
qof.qualification_annual_reporting_descripti: Submit compliance certification annually with federal tax return
qof.qualification_180_day_description: Investors must invest capital gains within 180 days of realization
qof.qualification_substantial_improvement_de: Must improve existing QOZ property by amount equal to purchase price within 30 months
qof.formation_step1_text: Organize as corporation or partnership for investment purposes
qof.formation_step2_text: File IRS Form 8996 to certify QOF status
qof.formation_step3_text: Purchase or develop qualifying property within designated zones
qof.formation_step4_text: Meet 90% asset test measured semi-annually, file annual certifications
qof.formation_step5_text: Maintain records of all QOZ property investments and improvements

internationalHub.title: International Hub
internationalHub.teal_description: APOZ's International Hub serves as a global trade gateway connecting Asia-Pacific manufacturers with U.S. markets through FTZ-171 duty-free operations, cross-border e-commerce platforms, advanced manufacturing clusters, and tax-advantaged investment structures for international capital.
internationalHub.core_functions_title: Core Functions of the International Hub
internationalHub.intro1: APOZ International Hub is strategically positioned along the Houston Gulf Coast Corridor in Winnie, Texas, with designation within both Qualified Opportunity Zone (QOZ) and Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ-171).
internationalHub.intro2: The purpose is to create a cross-border trade and innovation hub connecting Asia-Pacific manufacturers, U.S. markets, and global logistics networks.
internationalHub.targetPartner1: Asia-Pacific manufacturing firms seeking U.S. market entry
internationalHub.targetPartner4: Investment funds leveraging QOZ & FTZ incentives
internationalHub.coreFunction1_description: APOZ serves as an international logistics platform for Asia-Pacific companies importing/exporting goods.
internationalHub.coreFunction1_impact: Expands U.S. market access for Asia-based manufacturers.
internationalHub.coreFunction2_description: Dedicated bonded warehouses & last-mile distribution for online retail fulfillment.
internationalHub.coreFunction2_impact: Reduces costs and shipping times for global sellers.
internationalHub.coreFunction3_description: High-tech industrial clusters for clean energy, EV components, hydrogen, and electronics.
internationalHub.coreFunction4_description: Offers tax-advantaged entry for global investors through Qualified Opportunity Funds (QOFs).
internationalHub.coreFunction4_impact: Maximizes investor returns and increases APOZ competitiveness.
internationalHub.advantage1: FTZ-171 Status: Duty-free imports/exports for global supply chains.
internationalHub.advantage2: QOZ Tax Benefits: Attracts global capital through capital gains tax deferral and tax-free growth.
internationalHub.advantage3: Proximity to Houston Port: Seamless integration with one of the busiest shipping hubs in the U.S.
internationalHub.advantage4: Asia-Pacific Connectivity: Focused on serving Chinese, ASEAN, Korean, Japanese, and Indian manufacturers seeking 'friend-shoring' options.
internationalHub.industry1_description: Solar panels, EV batteries, hydrogen fuel cells, energy storage.
internationalHub.industry3_description: Ideal for Asia-Pacific exporters leveraging APOZ's bonded facilities.
internationalHub.industry4_description: Robotics, IoT integration, and predictive logistics.
internationalHub.investorBenefits_combinedIncentive1: Zero U.S. federal capital gains tax after 10 years.
internationalHub.investorBenefits_combinedIncentive2: Lower operational costs via duty elimination.
internationalHub.investorBenefits_roiPotential1: Strong demand from Asia-Pacific manufacturers relocating to the U.S.
internationalHub.investorBenefits_roiPotential2: Integrated affordable workforce housing (Phase 2: 2,000 homes) supports stable tenant retention.
internationalHub.investorBenefits_exitOpportunity3: Strategic portfolio sale to institutional funds

ftzZone.title: Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ-171)
ftzZone.intro1: A Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ) is a designated secure area within the U.S., considered outside of U.S. Customs territory for duty purposes.
ftzZone.intro2: Companies can import, store, assemble, manufacture, and re-export goods without paying U.S. customs duties until they enter U.S. commerce.
ftzZone.intro3: APOZ's planned FTZ-171 designation in Texas allows investors and tenants to enjoy these benefits.
ftzZone.process1_process: File with the U.S. Foreign-Trade Zones Board for activation.
ftzZone.process2_process: Coordinate with U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) for site inspection & approval.
ftzZone.process3_process: Tenants import raw materials or finished goods into the zone duty-free.
ftzZone.process4_process: Goods can be processed, assembled, packaged, or stored within the zone.
ftzZone.process5_process: Duties are paid only when goods leave FTZ into U.S. markets.
ftzZone.process6_process: Goods shipped overseas incur zero U.S. customs duties.
ftzZone.benefit1_impact: Pay customs duties only when products enter the U.S. market.
ftzZone.benefit3_impact: If components have higher duties than finished products, pay the lower finished-product duty rate.
ftzZone.benefit4_impact: Lower upfront costs improve working capital and investor ROI.
ftzZone.benefit5_impact: If your project is also in a Qualified Opportunity Zone (QOZ), you combine capital gains tax deferral with customs savings.
ftzZone.challenge1_explanation: Requires federal and CBP approvals, which can take 6–12 months.
ftzZone.challenge1_bestPractice: Hire an experienced FTZ consultant early.
ftzZone.challenge2_explanation: Must maintain inventory tracking and reporting to CBP.
ftzZone.challenge4_explanation: Structuring both FTZ & QOZ benefits can be complicated.
ftzZone.challenge4_bestPractice: Use tax counsel to maximize combined incentives.
ftzZone.bestPractice_earlyEngagement: Bring FTZ specialists and customs brokers into the project planning stage.
ftzZone.bestPractice_integratedIncentives: Combine FTZ + QOZ + State & Local Incentives to maximize investor ROI.
ftzZone.bestPractice_digitalInventory: Use ERP systems to manage bonded inventory and avoid CBP penalties.
ftzZone.bestPractice_investorPitch: Highlight FTZ benefits in financing decks — especially duty savings and IRR improvements.

qofZone.title: Qualified Opportunity Fund (QOF)
qofZone.intro1: A QOF stands for Qualified Opportunity Fund — it's a special investment vehicle created under the 2017 U.S. Tax Cuts and Jobs Act to channel private capital into Qualified Opportunity Zones (QOZs) and unlock major tax incentives for investors.
qofZone.intro2: Since your APOZ project sits in a QOZ, setting up or partnering with a QOF can significantly boost investor participation.
qofZone.definition1: A QOF is a corporation or partnership formed specifically to invest in qualified projects inside designated QOZs.
qofZone.definition2: Investors must put their capital gains into a QOF — not directly into the project — to receive the full QOZ tax benefits.
qofZone.process1_process: Investor sells stock, crypto, business, or property and realizes gains.
qofZone.process2_process: Within 180 days, investor contributes gains into a QOF.
qofZone.process3_process: QOF invests at least 90% of assets into QOZ projects like APOZ.
qofZone.process4_process: Investors hold their QOF shares for 5, 7, or 10+ years to unlock tax breaks.
qofZone.process5_process: After 10+ years, any appreciation on the QOF investment is tax-free.
qofZone.requirement1_rule: At least 90% of QOF assets must be in QOZ property or businesses.
qofZone.requirement1_impact: Ensures funds support the intended community.
qofZone.requirement2_rule: Investors must invest capital gains into the QOF within 180 days of realizing them.
qofZone.requirement3_rule: If buying existing property, QOF must double the investment basis within 30 months.
qofZone.benefit1_description: Taxes on reinvested gains are deferred until Dec 31, 2026.
qofZone.benefit2_description: If held 10+ years, any appreciation on QOF shares is 100% tax-free.
qofZone.benefit3_description: QOF status can unlock a pool of high-net-worth individuals, family offices, and institutions looking for tax-advantaged investments.

qofZone.example_withQOF_detail2: If APOZ investment appreciates to $5M after 10 years:
qofZone.criticalReason1: Many institutional & high-net-worth investors require a QOF structure to access QOZ tax benefits.
qofZone.criticalReason2: Makes your bilingual APOZ investor deck more attractive.
qofZone.criticalReason3: Combined with FTZ status, this creates a dual-incentive model:
qofZone.criticalReason4: QOZ: Capital gains tax benefits for investors.
qofZone.criticalReason5: FTZ: Duty-free advantages for APOZ tenants.

qozZone.title: Qualified Opportunity Zone (QOZ)
qozZone.intro: A QOZ is a geographically designated area where investors can receive special federal tax benefits when they invest through a Qualified Opportunity Fund (QOF) into real estate, business developments, or industrial projects within that zone.
qozZone.process1_process: An investor sells stock, real estate, or another asset, creating a capital gain.
qozZone.process2_process: Within 180 days, invest those gains into a Qualified Opportunity Fund.
qozZone.process3_process: The QOF deploys capital into QOZ-approved projects like APOZ.
qozZone.process4_process: Keep the investment 5, 7, or 10+ years to unlock tax incentives.
qozZone.process5_process: Sell the project or shares after 10+ years tax-free on appreciation.
qozZone.benefit1_details: Pay no federal tax on reinvested gains until Dec 31, 2026.
qozZone.benefit2_benefit: Step-Up in Basis (Expired for new investors)
qozZone.benefit2_details: Previously reduced taxable gains by up to 15% after 7 years, but ended in 2021.
qozZone.benefit3_details: After 10+ years, pay zero federal capital gains tax on profits from the QOZ investment.
qozZone.example_scenario: If an investor sells stock for a $1M gain and invests into APOZ via a QOF:
qozZone.example_point1: No tax now → money keeps compounding.
qozZone.example_point2: After 10 years → 100% of new profits are tax-free.
qozZone.whyMatters1: Your Asia Pacific Opportunity Zone (APOZ) project in Winnie, Texas, is strategically positioned within a designated QOZ.
qozZone.whyMatters2: This creates a double incentive for investors:
qozZone.whyMatters3: Higher IRR & ROI due to capital gains tax deferral + tax-free growth.
qozZone.whyMatters4: Boosts valuation and investor appetite, especially for REIT exits or IPO conversion.
qozZone.whyMatters5: Enhances long-term tenant attraction and capital inflows.
qozZone.synergy1_taxBenefit: Capital gains tax deferral + tax-free growth
qozZone.synergy3_taxBenefit: Lower overall project costs + higher returns
qozZone.synergy3_impact: Makes APOZ more competitive for both investors & tenants
qozZone.bestPractice1: Set Up a Qualified Opportunity Fund (QOF) — Required to unlock investor tax benefits.
qozZone.bestPractice2: Market to High-Gain Investors — Target those selling stock, crypto, or real estate.
qozZone.bestPractice3: Integrate in Pitch Decks — Show IRR improvements from tax savings.
qozZone.bestPractice4: Align with FTZ Incentives — Combine QOZ + FTZ benefits for maximum attractiveness.

summary.text: The APOZ Master Plan establishes a comprehensive framework for developing a world-class industrial and residential ecosystem in Winnie, Texas. Strategically positioned within both a Qualified Opportunity Zone and Foreign Trade Zone (FTZ-171), the master plan integrates multiple components to create competitive advantages for investors and tenants. Our International Hub serves as a cross-border trade gateway connecting Asia-Pacific manufacturers with U.S. markets, while dual tax incentives and comprehensive infrastructure planning create an unmatched environment for industrial, residential, and commercial growth.

internationalHub.title: International Hub
internationalHub.description: Global business gateway integrating FTZ operations with international partnerships. Trade facilitation, business services, cultural exchange, and cross-border collaboration platform.

ftzZone.title: FTZ Zone
ftzZone.description: Foreign Trade Zone with customs advantages, duty deferral, streamlined logistics, and regulatory flexibility. Supporting international manufacturing, distribution, and value-added operations.

qofZone.title: QOF Zone
qofZone.description: Qualified Opportunity Fund structure enabling capital gains tax deferral and exclusion. Long-term investment vehicle targeting 10+ year hold periods with QOZ tax benefits and community impact.

qozZone.title: QOZ Zone
qozZone.description: Qualified Opportunity Zone designation providing tax incentives for long-term investment. Capital gains deferral, basis step-up (10%), and permanent exclusion (10 years+) driving community development.

industryZone.description: Manufacturing and industrial district leveraging FTZ advantages for international trade and production. Advanced manufacturing, logistics, and value-added processing facilities.
